intro: Sedum pacense, commonly known as the Pacific stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the western United States. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements make it a popular ornamental plant.
